Speaker: klingon captain
Dialogue: Visual.

Speaker: klingon captain
Dialogue: Tactical again. Stand by on torpedoes.

Speaker: klingon captain
Dialogue: Full force fields; evasive maneuvers.

Speaker: klingon captain
Dialogue: ... severely damaged. Returning fire...

Speaker: klingon captain
Dialogue: Imperial Klingon Cruiser Amar... severely damaged by unfamiliar weaponry... intruder unidentified..

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Our sensor drone is intercepting

Speaker: branch
Dialogue: That's within Klingon boundaries. Who are they fighting?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Unknown, sir.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: I have an exterior visual!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: We've plotted a course on that cloud, Commander: it will pass into Federation Space fairly close to us.

Speaker: branch
Dialogue: Heading?

Speaker: lieutenant's voice
Dialogue: Sir, it's on a precise heading for Earth.

Speaker: male master
Dialogue: Spock . . . !

Speaker: female master
Dialogue: Here are these sands, our fore- bearers cast out their animal passions. Here our race was saved by the first attainment of Kolinahr.

Speaker: male master
Dialogue: Kolinahr: the final shedding of all emotion.

Speaker: female master
Dialogue: You have labored long, Spock. Now receive from us this symbol of total logic.

Speaker: female master
Dialogue: Come, give me your thoughts.

Speaker: female master
Dialogue: Our minds, Spock... One and together....

Speaker: female master
Dialogue: He will not achieve his goal with us. His answer lies elsewhere.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Commander Sonak... !

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You've received your appointment as Enterprise Science Officer?

Speaker: sonak
Dialogue: Based, I am told, on your recommendation, Admiral. Thank you.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Why aren't you on board?

Speaker: sonak
Dialogue: Captain Decker requested I complete final Science briefing here before...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Here at Starfleet...? The Enterprise is in final preparation to leave dock...

Speaker: sonak
Dialogue: Which will require twenty more hours at minimum, Admiral...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Twelve! I'm on my way to a meeting with Admiral Nogura which will not last more than three minutes. Report to me on the Enterprise in one hour.

Speaker: sonak
Dialogue: To you, sir?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I intend to be there following that meeting. Report to me. One hour!

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Admiral, I've been hoping to see you. Maybe you can get through to those thick heads in Starfleet that...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Why aren't the Enterprise transporters in operation, Mister Scott?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: We're hoping it's only a temporary problem, Admiral...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: See that it is.  Take me over, please.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Admiral, the Enterprise has just finished eighteen months redesign- ing and refitting. She needs testing, a shakedown...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Scott, there's an alien object with unbelievable destructive power less than three days away from this planet...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: ... the only Starship in interception range is the Enterprise! Ready, or not, she launches in twelve hours!

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: The crew hasn't had near enough transition time with all the new equipment. And the engines, Admiral: they've yet to be even tested at warp power. Add to that, an untried Captain...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Two and a half years as Chief of Starfleet Operations may have made me a little stale, Mr. Scott -- but I wouldn't exactly consider myself 'untried.'

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They gave her back to me, Scotty.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: "Gave' her back, sir...? I doubt it was that easy...  And she'll be ready.

Speaker: ensign
Dialogue: Granted, sir. Welcome aboard, Admiral... Commander Scott, you're needed in Engineering immediately.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Sir, you'll excuse me...?

Speaker: ensign
Dialogue: Sir, if you'll follow me, I'll...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I think I can find my way, Ensign.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bridge!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Captain... Starfleet just signaled your transfer-of- command orders!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I appreciate the welcome; I wish the circumstances were less critical.  Where is Captain Decker?

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: He's in Engineering, sir...  He doesn't know.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr Chekov, assemble the crew on the Rec Deck at 0400 hours. I want to show them what we're facing.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: I wouldn't have wanted to have been standing in his way. He wanted her back; he got her!

Speaker: alien ensign
Dialogue: And Captain Decker? He's been with the ship every minute of her refitting...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Ensign -- our chances of coming back from this mission in one piece may have just doubled...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: I thought so! See... the trans- porter sensor was not activated...

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Clearly, put a back-up sensor into the unit.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Admiral Kirk...  She'll launch on schedule if we have to tow her out with our bare hands. Right, Scotty?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Aye, sir, that we will...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Will, let's go over here and talk.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Let me now when the back-up is in place.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: All due respect, sir, I hope this isn't a Starfleet pep talk; I'm just too busy.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'm taking over the Center seat. I'm sorry, Will.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: You are what...?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'm replacing you as Captain of the Enterprise.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You'll stay aboard as Executive Officer... a temporary grade reduction to Commander.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: -- You, personally, are assuming command?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: May I ask Why?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: My experience -- five years out there dealing with unknowns like this -- my familiarity with the Enterprise, this crew...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Admiral, this is an almost totally new enterprise. You don't know her a tenth as well as I do.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That's why you're staying aboard. I'm sorry, Will.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: No, Admiral. I don't think you are; not one damned bit. I remember when you recommended me for this command. You told me how envious you were, and if only you could find a way to get a starship command again. Well, sir, it looks like you found a way.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Report to the bridge, Commander. Immediately.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Transporter room, do not engage! Do not....

Speaker: rand
Dialogue: Starfleet, override us! OVERRIDE...! Yank them back!

Speaker: starfleet voice
Dialogue: Unable to retrieve their pattern, Enterprise....!

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: We're losing the pattern...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Starfleet, boost your matter gain; we need more signal!

Speaker: rand
Dialogue: Oh, no! They're forming!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Oh, my God...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Starfleet, do you have them?

Speaker: starfleet voice
Dialogue: Enterprise... what we got back didn't live long. Fortunately.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Starfleet... Kirk. Please... express my condolences to their families. Commander Sonak's can be reached through the Vulcan Embassy.  There was nothing you could have done, Rand. It wasn't your fault.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Turboshaft eight...?

Speaker: yeoman
Dialogue: Back that way, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We'll have to replace Commander Sonak. I'd still like a Vulcan there, if possible...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: None available, Captain. There's no one in fact, who's fully rated on this design.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You are, Mister Decker. I'm afraid you'll have to double as Science Officer.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That's all we know about it; except that it's now 2.2 days from Earth. Enterprise is the only Federation starship that stands in its way.

Speaker: bridge voice
Dialogue: Bridge to Captain. Priority signal from Epsilon Nine --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Put it on the viewer here...!

Speaker: branch
Dialogue: We're transmitting linguacode friendship messages on all frequencies. No response.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: I have a null reading at the center of the 'cloud,' sir.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Definitely something inside.. there but all scans are being reflected back.  They seem to be reacting to our scans, sir.

Speaker: branch
Dialogue: Deflectors, emergency full!

Speaker: branch
Dialogue: We are under attack...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: External view...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Pre-launch countdown will commence in forty minutes.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Transporters Room and Chief Engineer Scott report trans- porter system fully repaired and now functioning normally, sir.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Dock signals clear, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Rely we are holding position awaiting final crew replacements.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Captain, Transporter Personnel reports the Navigator...  is already aboard, and en route to the bridge.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: She's a Deltan.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And there are no finer navigators in Starfleet, Commander.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Lieutenant Ilia reporting for duty, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Welcome aboard, Lieutenant.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Hello, Ilia.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Decker....!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: I was stationed on the Lieutenant's home planet some years ago...

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: 'Commander' Decker?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Our Exec and Science Officer...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain Kirk has the utmost confidence in me.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And in you, too, Lieutenant.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: My oath of celibacy is on record Captain. May I assume my duties?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: By all means.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Captain, Starfleet reports our last six crew members ready to beam up...  ... but one of them is refusing to step into the transporter.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Oh? I'll see that he beams up...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Mr. Sulu, take Lieutenant Ilia in hand.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Your pre-programming is already set in, Lieutenant.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: I'm sworn to celibacy, Mister Sulu. That makes me as safe as any human female.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: I now the Captain meant no person- al insult.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: You can assure him that's true, can't you?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yeoman, what was the problem down there?

Speaker: yeoman
Dialogue: He insisted we go first, sir. Said something about first seeing how it scrambled our molecules.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Thank you, Yeoman  Starfleet , this is Captain Kirk. The officer is to be beamed up immediately!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Well, for a man who swore he'd never return to Starfleet...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They didn't...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bones, there's a 'thing' out there --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: -- headed this way. I need you...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bones, I need you badly.

Speaker: rand
Dialogue: Permission granted, sir!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: All decks, this is the Captain. Prepare or immediate departure.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Dock control reports ready, sir.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Helm ready, sir.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Orbital departure on plot, sir.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Yard command signaling clear, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Maneuvering thrusters, Mister Sulu.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Maneuvering thrusters, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hold station.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Thrusters at station-keeping, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Thrusters ahead, Mister Sulu. Take us out.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Intermix set, Bridge, impulse power at your discretion.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Impulse power, Mr Sulu. Ahead Warp point-five.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Departure angle on viewer.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Departure angle.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Viewer ahead.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain, assuming we have full Warp capability, accelerating to Warp Seven on leaving solar system will bring us to IP with the Intruder in twenty point one hours.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Science Officer's computations confirmed, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Well, Bones, do the new medical facilities meet with your approval?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Programming ready?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Program set for standard Warp entry, Captain...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: ... but I still recommend further simulation study.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mister Decker; every minute brings that object nearer Earth!  Engineering! Stand by for Warp Drive.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engineer, we need Warp speed now!

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Hold one minute, please, Captain --

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: It's borderline on the simulator, Captain: I canna guarantee that she'll...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Warp Drive, Mr Scott.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Ahead Warp One, Mr Sulu.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Accelerating to Warp One, sir.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Warp point seven... point eight ... nine...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Warp One, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Decker --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Wormhole!... Get us back on impulse power! Full reverse!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Negative helm control, Captain! Going reverse on impulse power...!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Subspace frequencies are jammed by Wormhole effect!

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Collision alert...! Collision alert...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Negative control from inertial lag will continue 22 point five seconds before forward velocity slows to sub-light speed.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Unidentified small object has been pulled into the wormhole with us, Captain! Directly ahead...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Forcefields up full! Put object on viewer...!

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Navigational deflectors inoperative...!  Directional control also inoperative, Captain...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Wormhole distortion has over- loaded main power systems...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Time to impact...?

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Twelve seconds...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Chekov, stand by on the phasers...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Delay that phaser order! Arm photon torpedoes...!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Photon torpedoes armed...!

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Object is an asteroid, reading mass point seven...  Impact in eight seconds... seven... six... five...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Fire torpedoes...!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Torpedoes away...!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: We're out of it...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: We are at warp point eight. Position report, Navigator..?

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Helm control restored, sir.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Computing new interception course.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Communications are normal, Captain.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: No casualties reported, sir.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Engineer... report status there.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: In just a second, Exec; we're picking up the pieces down here.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Warp Drive as soon as possible, Mr. Scott.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That object out there is less than two days from Earth, Mister Scott. We've got to intercept while it still is out there!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Decker, I'd like to see you in my quarters.  You have the conn, Mr. Sulu.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Maintaining warp point eight; I show our new heading

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Lieutenant Ilia...?

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Confirmed, Mr. Sulu. Confirmed.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Explanation, Mr. Decker: Why was my phaser order countermanded?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Sir, the Enterprise redesign increases phaser power by channeling it through the main engines. When they went into anti-matter imbalance, the phasers were automatically cut off.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Then you acted properly, of course.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Thank you, sir. I'm sorry I embar- rassed you.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You saved the ship.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: I'm aware of that, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Stop competing with me, Decker!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Permission to speak freely, sir?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Granted.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Sir, you haven't logged a single star hour in two and a half years. That, plus your unfamiliarity with the ship's design -- in my opinion, sir, seriously jeopardizes our mission.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I trust you will... nursemaid me through these difficulties, Mister?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Yes, sir, I'll do that.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Then I won't keep you from your duties any longer, Commander.  Yes, Doctor?

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Was he difficult?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: No more than I expected  Not as difficult as this. I'm sorry...

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: That you left? or that you didn't say 'goodbye'?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: If I'd seen you again, would you have been able to say it?

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Get out of here, Bones.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Make your point, Doctor.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I intend to keep her, is that what you're saying, Doctor?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Viewer on.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: For what purpose?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: It is a courier, Captain. Grade One priority. Non-belligerency confirmed.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Very well, Mr. Chekov, see to it. Viewer off.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Is there anything further?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Permission to come aboard, sir?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Granted, sir! Granted!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock...! Spock, where...how...?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Commander, if I may...?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I have been monitoring your Starfleet transmissions, Captain, your engine design difficulties.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I offer my services as Science Officer.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: If our Executive Officer has no objections...?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Of course not. I'm aware of Mister Spock's qualifications.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mister Chekov, log Mister Spock's Starfleet commission reactivated; list him as Science Officer; both effective immediately.

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: Mr. Spock...!!!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: That's how we all feel, Mister...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: With your permission, I will now discuss these fuel equations with the Engineer.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mister Spock, welcome aboard!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Warp point eight... point nine...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Warp one, sir.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Warp two, sir... warp three...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Reporting as ordered, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Sit down, please.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Sir, I would appreciate Dr. McCoy absenting himself from this interview.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I want him here.  Sit down!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You've reported that you felt strong thought emotions. A group of minds from a space vessel? Could you make out any plan, anything to do with Earth?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Negative, Captain. I could sense only what seemed an almost omniscient pattern of perfect logic. I can explain nothing more; I understand nothing more.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Also -- there was nothing in your report about why you're here.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: That inquiry invades my personal life, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I inquired about you -- learned you were studying with the Masters...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Your deductions do you credit, Doctor... if your puerile curiosity does not.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I still contain fragments of my human half.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And whatever you sensed out here....

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: ... is my only hope of accomplishing what the Masters could not.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Let it drop, Bones.  You are my Science Officer -- I'll expect an immediate report on anything further you learn or sense from here on.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I have accepted service here as a Starfleet officer... sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I know this has been painful, Spock. For me too. Thank you.

Speaker: chekov's voice
Dialogue: Red alert! Red alert!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Full mag on viewer!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Linguacode?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Continuing friendship messages on all frequencies, sir.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: All decks and divisions confirm status red.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: We are being scanned, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Do not return scan, Mr. Spock! It may be misinterpreted as hostility!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Intruder scans emanate from the exact cloud center. Energy of a type entirely un- known to me.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: No response to friendship messages, Captain.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Should I go to battle stations, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Negative, We'll take no prov- ocative action.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Recommend defensive posture, Captain: Screens and shields.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: No...  Cloud composition, Mr. Spock?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Twelve power energy field --

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: -- twelve power?!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain, we've seen what their weapons can do. Shouldn't we take every possible precaution -- ?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr Decker....

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain, I suspect there's an object at the heart of that cloud.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Decker, I will not provoke an attack, If that order isn't clear to you...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain, as your Exec, it's my duty to point out alternatives.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Five minutes to Cloud boundary!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Navigator, lay in a conic section flight path into the cloud center; bring us parallel to whatever we find in there...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: That measures twelve power? Ten thousands of starships couldn't generate that much...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: They have... they have been communicating with us. I sense ... puzzlement. Why have we not replied?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Communicated with us how?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Signal medical alert, Mister Chekov!

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Incoming fire. Ahead. Zero, ... mark, zero. Incoming fire. Ahead. Zero, mark, zero.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Forcefields and deflectors up full, Captain.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Bypass...! Alternate Integrators!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: The new screens held...!

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: No, I can stop his pain.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain, the Intruder has been attempting to communicate! Now placing their transmission on the speaker...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: ... frequency more than one million megahertz at such high speed their entire message lasts only a millisecond.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I suspect our messages were too slow for them to be noticed.  Programming computer to send linguacode at their rate.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Here it comes...!

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Incoming fire. Ahead, zero, mark, zero, point two. Incoming fire. Ahead, zero, zero, mark, zero...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engineering... what's happening to our forcefields?!

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Systems are overloading, Captain! Our shields cannot handle another attack!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Spock?

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Impact in fifteen seconds...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Transmit, Mr. Spock! Now!

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Ten seconds....

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Transmitting...!

Speaker: ilia's voice
Dialogue: ... five seconds.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: It appears that our message has been understood, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Any reply from them?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Negative, no reply, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock, have you sensed anything else?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The 'puzzlement' I sensed was fleeting... minor...  ... as if carrying a sense of our insignificance, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Our... 'insignificance'?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: We are obviously confronted by a highly advanced mentality... yet they cannot understand who we are, or what we want.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: But they understood our messages; they broke off the attack.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: They may have attacked only as a warning to us, Captain. To keep away.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: That would presuppose a feeling, Commander... compassion. I sensed no emotion, only...  ... pure logic.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Tactical plot on viewer.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Thirty seconds to Cloud boundary...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Opinion, Mister. Spock?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Recommend we proceede, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Decker... ?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: I advise caution, Captain; we can't withstand another attack.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That thing is twenty hours from Earth. We know nothing about it yet.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: That's precisely the point, Captain. We don't know it will do. Moving into the cloud -- at this time, is an unwarranted gamble.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: How do you define unwarranted, mister?!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: You asked my opinion, sir.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Fifteen seconds to Cloud Boundary.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Viewer, standard ahead.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Sulu, steady as she goes.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: No vessel could generate a powerfield of this magnitude...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Instruments fluctuating, Captain. Patterns unrecognizable.

Speaker: sulu's voice
Dialogue: Captain....!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Incredible dimensions, Sir! ... I make it as seventy-eight kilometers in length...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: It could hold a crew of tens of thousands...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Evaluation, Mister Spock?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: That vessel is generating a forcefield measurably greater than the radiation of the Earth's sun.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Transmit image of the Alien to Starfleet; advise we are attempting further communication.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Unable to make contact with Starfleet. Our transmissions out of the Cloud are being reflected back.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Distance to object now seventy- thousand kilometers...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: We're closing in on it rapidly, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Reduce magnification. Factor 4, Mr. Sulu.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: We're already two settings below that, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Adjust parallel course, Navigator. Bring us in to one hundred kilometers distance.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: One hundred kilometers...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hold relative position here...

Speaker: computer's voice
Dialogue: Intruder alert...!  Intruder alert!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: No weapons...!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Security... do not send further teams!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Can that be one of their crew?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: A plasma-energy combination...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Don't interfere with it...!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Absolutely, I will not interfere!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: No one interfere...! It doesn't seem interested in us -- only the ship...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Computer off!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: It's taken control of the computer...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: It's running our records! Starfleet strength, Earth defenses...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: We could have cut it off at the main computer...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: This served the purpose.

Speaker: ilia
Dialogue: Mr. Spock, don't move...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: This is how I define unwarranted!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: The ship is under attack...! Man all defensive stations...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Forcefields, full remaining strength...! Total reserve!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain, we have been seized by a tractor beam...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engineering... full emergency power!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Chief Difalco to the bridge; on the double!

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Going to full emergency...  But Captain, if we don't break free in fifteen seconds, she'll burn up...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: We cannot break free, Captain.  We do not have a fraction of the power necessary.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Delay that order, Scotty...! Disengage all main drive systems!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain, suggest a maximum phaser strike directly at the beam might weaken it just enough for us to break free --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Break free to where, Commander...?  Any show of resistance would not only be futile, Catain...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: We don't know that, Mr. Spock. Why are you opposed to trying?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: They're pulling us inside...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Why bring us inside? Not to destroy us; they could have done that outside.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They could have many ways of destroying things, Mr. Decker.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Something about us puzzles them... perhaps even concerns them.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Captain, photic-sonar readings indicate the aperture is closing; we're trapped, sir...!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Reverse angle on the viewer, Captain.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The tractor beam has released us, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Viewer ahead.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Viewer ahead, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Maneuvering thrusters, Mr. Sulu; ahead one third.  Full sensor scan, Mr. Spock; they can't expect us not to look them over now!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Thrusters ahead, one third.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Commencing sensor scans.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: It's closing up...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hold station...!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Thrusters at station keeping...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: All scans are being reflected back, Captain. Our sensors are useless.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Have you been able to analyze any of this...?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I believe the light flares to be energy fields -- undoubtedly part of the vessel's inner mechanism. A technology so incredibly sophisticated that I cannot --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Deck four, Captain; Officers' Quarters...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Have a security team meet me at Deck Four main elevator!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Who is...'V'ger'...?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Is V'ger the Captain of the alien vessel?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Where is Lt. Ilia?

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: "Carbon-based units"...?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Why does V'ger travel to the third planet of the solar system directly ahead?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Find the Creator? What Creator? Whose...!?  What does V'ger want of the 'Creator'... ?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Join with the Creator... ? How?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Who is the Creator?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Who is V'ger?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Doctor, a thorough examination of this probe might provide some insight into those who manufactured it, and how to deal with them.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The examination is a normal function.

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: And every exocrine system is here, too --

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: -- even eye moisture.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Interesting. Not 'Decker-unit'?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain... this probe may be a key a key to the Aliens.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: It's a programmed mechanism, Mr. Spock...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: We have just seen that its body duplicates our navigator in precise detail. Suppose that beneath its programming, the real Ilia's memory patterns are duplicated with equal precision.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They had a pattern to follow...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: ... they may have followed it too precisely.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Ilia's memory, her feelings of loyalty, friendship, obedience... might all be there.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Exactly.  And you did have a 'relationship' with Lieutenant Ilia, Commander.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: That probe in there -- in a different form now -- is the same thing that killed Ilia!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Commander, we're locked in an alien vessel, six hours from Earth orbit, our only contact with our captors is the probe. If we can control it, persuade it, use it in some way...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The Decker-unit can assist you with much greater efficiency...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Carry on with your assignment, Mr. Decker.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock? Concerned about his chances?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I am uneasy with that being our only hope of more information.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: All these vessels were called "Enterprise".

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: A faint signal from Starfleet, sir. They have the intruder on their monitors...  They show us... three hours... twenty-four minutes from Earth!

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: The carbon units use this area for recreation...  What type of recreation does the crew aboard your vessel enjoy...?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Ilia 'enjoyed' this game... she nearly always won --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Damn...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: The crews of the previous Enterprises were also carbon units. In what way is the life form in your vessel different?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: What is Enterprise's proper evolvement?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Enterprise would be unable to function without carbon units.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: What does that mean?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Within you are memory patterns of a carbon unit. If I can help you revive these patterns; you could understand our functions better.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Computer, commence recording. Captain Kirk -- this message will detail my attempt to contact the aliens...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Starfleet signals, sir, growing in strength...  They -- have Intruder on their monitors -- it's decelerating -- powerfield cloud beginning to dissipate...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Confirm, Captain. Lunar beacons indicate Intruder on a course into Earth orbit...

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Sir! Airlock four has been opened; a thruster suit is reported missing!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Get a fix on his position!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: ... I don't want him stopped, Bones; I want him to lead me to whatever's out there...!

Speaker: sulu's voice
Dialogue: Bridge, Captain. We make Spock as 26 Mark 345 degrees off ship's axis.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I have him in sight.

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: I remember Lt. Ilia once mentioning that she wore this...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: ... when we met.

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: Put it on.

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: Ilia...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: On Delta... remember...?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Then tell us who V'ger is; where he's from... W need your help.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: They want to make contact with V'ger...  Ilia...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Does V'ger object to the presence of the two carbon units?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: You said V'ger's purpose was to find and join with the Creator.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bridge...!

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: ... stand by, I may be in trouble...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Your phaser, Captain...! Use your phaser...!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Airlocks two and four -- prepare to launch rescue teams!  Chief Lang! Get them out there! Fast!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Mr. Spock, the Captain is in trouble, directly behind you -- three hundred meters!  Mr. Spock!

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: ... Spock...! ... need help...! ... trapped...!

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: ... pressure on me...! ... can't move...! Spock...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bridge, cancel rescue teams.  Spock, what in the hell are you doing out here!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I am seeking answers, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Answers to what, Spock? Our dilemma -- or your personal one?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain, I believe there we will find an indication of whoever -- or whatever -- is aboard this vessel...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: It would appear that the atomic arrays of these crystals store information. A remarkably efficient system.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And these 'sensor-swarms' collect that data, carry it here.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: New crystals: they must contain the most recent data obtained --

Speaker: rapid
Dialogue: PROFUSION OF FAINT IMAGES, but this time including a pattern-like image of Klingons, Klingon vessels , and obvious Starfleet personnel -- and the Epsilon 9 station. Also, a

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Klingons... our Epsilon 9 station ... and Ilia!! They seem to be more than just images...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: If this is their ship's data banks, where is the crew? Or is their entire ship automated?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain, I do not believe there is a crew -- or that this is a vessel as such.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I am almost certain now that all of this is V'ger -- I believe that we are inside a life form, a living machine.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I must attempt mindmeld with it, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock, if you're right, its mind may be enormous...

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: Now scanning pons area at spinal nerve fiber connection...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Jim...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: ... is so far beyond V'ger's comprehension.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Were you right? Spock? V'ger is a living machine...?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: A life form of its own; a conscious, living entity.

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: A living machine...?!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And it considers the Enterprise a living machine: that's why the probe refers to our ship as an entity.

Speaker: chapel
Dialogue: If it thinks our ship is alive what does it think we are?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I saw V'ger's planet: a planet populated by living machines. Unbelievable technology.  I should have known...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Know what, Spock? What?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What should you have known?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: And, Jim, no answers...! Jim, it's looking for answers itself!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What answers?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: 'Is this all I am? Is there not more?'

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: A faint signal from Starfleet, sir! Intruder Cloud has been located on their outer monitors for past twenty-seven minutes... dissipating rapidly as it approaches.

Speaker: sulu's voice
Dialogue: Starfleet reports forward velocity has slowed to sub-warp speed! We are three minutes from Earth's orbit!-

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I need Spock on the bridge.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: A machine planet...? Sending a machine to Earth looking for its Creator...?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: 'To find the Creator,' the probe said. Find God...?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Chekov, Commander Decker's present location?

Speaker: chekov's voice
Dialogue: He... they... are in Engineering, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I want to make a ship's announcement. But it's to be heard only in Engineering.

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Ready, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: This is the Captain speaking. It appears that the alien ship... V'ger... is NOT a manned vessel...

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: It is a living entity...! A machine life form. We are attempting to ascertain its intentions. All personnel will maintain yellow alert status!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: A machine...! Then it had to be programmed. By whom...?

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: To join, and become One with the Creator?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Well, sir, now what about all that? A living entity, the Captain says... entity... A living thing...!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Thank you, Scotty...

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Your welcome, sir.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Lassie, if I were functioning 'logically,' right now I'd be showing you the inside of our scrap metal compactor!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: We're now locked into Starfleet's transceivers; Admiral Nogura has received your reports, sir.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: The visual is a lunar monitor relay, sir.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Heavy interference, sir -- it's coming from here, inside the intruder itself...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Puzzling! The interference appears to be a rather simple carrier wave code signal...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: On an old style radio frequency, sir...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: V'ger is announcing that it has arrived, sir -- that it's ready to deliver the information it was programmed to collect...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: It expects a return signal now, ordering it to transmit that information to the Creator.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Sir! V'ger's signals have stopped...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Picking up Starfleet again; a lunar monitor relay...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: ... however, Captain, they measure several hundred times more powerful!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: High mag, Mr. Sulu!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: The third one is moving off too -- a fourth one is forming...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: All Earth defense systems have gone dead.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Sir, Starfleet computes their trajectories as moving toward equidistant positions over Earth.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: From four equidistant positions, Captain, a detonation would blanket the entire surface of the planet.

Speaker: difalco
Dialogue: I plot them as reaching equidistant positions in... twenty-nine minutes, sir... mark!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Why?!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The carbon-units are not responsible for that.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Then V'ger believes the Creator to be a machine too.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: It seems we all imagine God in our own image.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Of course: we all create God in our own image.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: V'ger! If we are lesser beings, we are still, like you, living. And because we are alive, we -- like you -- wish to survive. You must not destroy --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Treat V'ger as you would... a child.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Child...!?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Yes, Captain, a child: evolving into adulthood -- learning, searching -- instinctively needing.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Needing what...?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: It doesn't know what it needs, Comm          ander...  It does not know.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The carbon--units-know-why-the Creator-has-not-responded.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Ilia... we can help V'ger find what it needs --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Not until V'ger withdraws the devices orbiting the third planet.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Secure all stations. Clear the bridge.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Bridge to all decks,secure your stations.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Clear the bridge, Captain...?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That was the order, Mr. Sulu: Clear the bridge.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bridge secure all stations! Move out!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: All ship's functions going to automatic, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: If V'ger destroys the Enterprise, the information V'ger requires will also be destroyed.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Because V'ger is going to destroy all the carbon units on the third planet.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The information will not be disclosed.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Then V'ger must withdraw its orbiting devices.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain, the vessel -- V'ger -- obviously operates from a central brain complex...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The orbiting devices would be controlled from the point, then...?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Precisely.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The carbon units' information cannot be disclosed to V'ger's probe... only to V'ger directly.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Forward motion, Captain...!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: A tractor beam...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain, what's the next move?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The question is, Mr. Decker, is there a next move...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Resume duty stations, Mr. Decker.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: All personnel resume stations...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Well, Mr. Decker, it seems my bluff is being called.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: I'm afraid our hand is pretty weak, Captain.  But it's the only game in town.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Chekov, when do those devices activate?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: They reach final position in... Twenty-seven minutes -- mark.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engineering...

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Scott, here, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Scott, be prepared to execute Starfleet order two zero zero five.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: When, Captain?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Why has the Captain ordered self- destruct, sir?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: I would say, lass, because he thinks -- he hopes -- that when we go up... we'll take V'ger with us.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Will we?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: When that much matter and anti- matter are brought together? Oh, yes; we will, indeed.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Twenty-five minutes to device activation, sir.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Starfleet has been apprised of our situation, Captain.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Tractor beam remains constant...

Speaker: difalco
Dialogue: We are seventeen kilometers inside the vessel...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock... Spock...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Spock -- I think...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Not for us?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: No, Captain, not for us... for V'ger.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I weep for V'ger, as I would for a brother -- far more knowledgeable than I -- and yet one step behind.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: As I was -- when I came aboard... so is V'ger now: empty, incomplete. Searching. Logic and knowledge are not enough.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Has not, Doctor -- and now, because of what we are planning... will not...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: There is no alternative.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Mr. Spock, what would V'ger need to fulfill itself?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: V'ger has begun to understand the true limits of our universe, thereby realizing the existence of other dimensions. To fulfill itself it must evolve to a higher dimension; V'ger believes this can be achieved only by joining with the Creator.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: 'Is this all that I am? Is there nothing more?

Speaker: difalco
Dialogue: Captain...!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Captain, I believe that is our destination.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Forward motion slowing, Captain...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engineering... Status, Mr. Scott?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Thank you, Scotty. Stand by.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Tractor beam strength lessening, Captain.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Scott... on my next signal.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The point...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The point is, Captain, twenty-two    (ALT.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: V'ger with certain information, we won't have twenty-two seconds; the plan must be implemented upon arrival.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain, we can't be sure that our... move... will actually save Earth.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Forward motion stopped, Captain.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Tractor beam is released.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Scott...

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Captain... I read an oxygen and gravity envelope forming outside the Enterprise...!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Sir, I have located the source of V'ger's radio signal:  directly ahead.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: That transmitter is a vital link between V'ger and the Creator.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: we can still save V'ger... and ourselves.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock, Bones...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Decker... I will contact you every five minutes. Otherwise... inform Mr. Scott immediately.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain... I'd like to go along...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Sulu, you have the conn...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: V'ger plans to literally meld to reduce both itself and the Creator to patterns...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: ... and then to reassemble itself combined with the Creator. The most certain way of obtaining all the Creator's answers.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Our data is being prepared.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We will answer and present proof of our answer when it is ready!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: V'ger, we will bring the Creator to you! Here!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: We need only a few more minutes. Believe me...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Ilia, believe me... the Creator will appear!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Problem, Captain: the response signal is not in our records. Voyager Six was sent out by Earth's "United States Subdivision.' The code was probably...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: And when V'ger melds? What will happen to you?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: There's no way to know. V'ger expected it to be a machine -- some single entity.  All of us here may be reduced into patterns...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: That seems to be what it has planned -- to have the Creator physically present here.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Commander...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Kirk here.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Stand by. Transmit it on my orders.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Enterprise... transmit.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Recording...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Enterprise, are you transmitting?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Confirm code and transmitting frequency.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: Captain Kirk!

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: The antenna leads have been disconnected. V'ger never intended to accept a transmitted signal.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Capture God! In order to retrieve V'ger's data, the Creator has to physically come here!...

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: And plug the signal directly into the circuitry at this...  ... point here, Captain. It should pick up even a tricorder playback.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Enterprise, I want that signal again. Transmit!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Jim... he wants it.

Speaker: decker
Dialogue: You got the Enterprise, it's what you wanted. This is what I want.  ... I'm the right choice for this mission.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock, we were its answer!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Yes, Captain. It needed our mortality, the fear of it, our struggle against it, our fears, our dreams...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: ... and the 'foolish' emotions which drive us?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I prefer your poet Dante's phrase -- 'the divine restlessness of the human spirit.'

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Starfleet signal, Captain! Return to orbital dockyard for inspection.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Ignore that signal.  Shall we give the Enterprise a proper shakedown, Mr. Scott?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: We can have you back on Vulcan in four days, Mr. Spock.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I have no business on Vulcan, Engineer.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Ahead Warp One, Mr. Sulu.

Speaker: difalco
Dialogue: Heading, sir?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Out there.  Thataway.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: A most logical choice, Captain.
